Procs

proc delete(app: App; pattern: string; handler: Handler) {.
    ...raises: [RegexError, KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Registers a DELETE route handler for the specified pattern.

Supports both exact matches and parameterized routes using :param syntax. Route parameters can be accessed via ctx.getParam("paramName").

Parameters: pattern: URL pattern to match (e.g., "/api/users/:id") handler: Async function to handle the request

Example:

app.delete("/api/users/:id", proc(ctx: Context): Future[void] {.async.} =
  let userId = ctx.getParam("id")
  await ctx.json(%*{"deleted": userId})
)

proc get(app: App; pattern: string; handler: Handler) {.
    ...raises: [RegexError, KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Registers a GET route handler for the specified pattern.

Supports both exact matches and parameterized routes using :param syntax. Route parameters can be accessed via ctx.getParam("paramName").

Parameters: pattern: URL pattern to match (e.g., "/users/:id", "/api/status") handler: Async function to handle the request

Example:

app.get("/", proc(ctx: Context): Future[void] {.async.} =
  await ctx.send("Hello World")
)

app.get("/users/:id", proc(ctx: Context): Future[void] {.async.} =
  let userId = ctx.getParam("id")
  await ctx.json(%*{"userId": userId})
)

proc listen(app: App; port: int; callback: proc () = nil): owned(
    Future[void]) {....stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, OSError, ValueError,
    SslError, LibraryError, KeyError], tags: [RootEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    ReadIOEffect, TimeEffect], forbids: [].}

Starts the HTTP server on the specified port.

This function starts the web server and begins listening for incoming HTTP requests. The server will handle requests using the configured routes and middleware.

Parameters: port: Port number to listen on (e.g., 3000, 8080) callback: Optional callback function to execute when server starts

Example:

waitFor app.listen(3000, proc() =
  echo "Server running at http://localhost:3000"
)

proc newApp(): App {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Creates a new Rakta application instance.

This function initializes a new web application with default settings, including empty routes, middlewares, and default port 3000. Automatically adds branding headers middleware.

Returns: App: A new application instance ready to be configured

Example:

let app = newApp()

proc post(app: App; pattern: string; handler: Handler) {.
    ...raises: [RegexError, KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Registers a POST route handler for the specified pattern.

Supports both exact matches and parameterized routes using :param syntax. Route parameters can be accessed via ctx.getParam("paramName"). Request body can be accessed via ctx.req.body or ctx.jsonBody().

Parameters: pattern: URL pattern to match (e.g., "/api/users", "/submit/:type") handler: Async function to handle the request

Example:

app.post("/api/users", proc(ctx: Context): Future[void] {.async.} =
  let userData = ctx.jsonBody()
  await ctx.json(%*{"created": userData})
)

proc put(app: App; pattern: string; handler: Handler) {.
    ...raises: [RegexError, KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Registers a PUT route handler for the specified pattern.

Supports both exact matches and parameterized routes using :param syntax. Route parameters can be accessed via ctx.getParam("paramName"). Request body can be accessed via ctx.req.body or ctx.jsonBody().

Parameters: pattern: URL pattern to match (e.g., "/api/users/:id") handler: Async function to handle the request

Example:

app.put("/api/users/:id", proc(ctx: Context): Future[void] {.async.} =
  let userId = ctx.getParam("id")
  let userData = ctx.jsonBody()
  await ctx.json(%*{"updated": userId, "data": userData})
)

proc serveStatic(app: App; staticDir: string; urlPrefix: string = ""): Handler {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Creates a static file serving middleware for the application.

This middleware serves static files from the specified directory. Files are served with appropriate MIME types and caching headers.

Parameters: staticDir: Directory path containing static files to serve urlPrefix: Optional URL prefix for static routes (default: "")

Returns: Handler: Middleware function that serves static files

Example:

app.use(app.serveStatic("public"))
app.use(app.serveStatic("assets", "/static"))

proc setStaticRoot(app: App; rootDir: string) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
proc use(app: App; middleware: Handler) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Adds a middleware function to the application.

Middleware functions are executed in order before route handlers. They can modify the request/response or call ctx.next() to continue to the next middleware or route handler.

Parameters: middleware: Async middleware function that processes Context

Example:

app.use(corsMiddleware())
app.use(app.serveStatic("public"))

app.use(proc(ctx: Context): Future[void] {.async.} =
  echo "Request to ", ctx.req.path
  await ctx.next()
)

Exports

App, Context, Request, SendFileOptions, Response, Route, Handler, send, getParam, json, status, getCookie, getQuery, setHeader, setCookie, sendFile, jsonBody, sendFile, newSendFileOptions, next, newResponse, newRequest, newContext, corsMiddleware
